page.title: Items
page.keywords: roblox, roblox bus sim, roblox bus simulator, roblox bus sim wiki, wiki, bus sim wiki, roblox bus sim wiki

header.title: Items
header.description: Items are tools that have their own special functions and abilities, mostly obtained by Events.

content.infoBoxDescription: The following items are obtainable at any point of the game.

items.listItemDescription:
The Airhorn is an expensive gamepass item in Bus Simulator, costing a huge R$275.

When used it produces a loud sound from where the player used it. It also has no cooldown per use.

The Airpods is an item that allows you to listen to Roblox Audio IDs locally, or syncing them to the Bus Radio, costing R$8.

Note: This also silences any and all outside noise.

Almond Water is a healing item obtainable from random floor spawns in the Backwalls event.

When used, you will gain a significant boost in speed and healing for a few seconds, being able to outrun Entities and move much quicker throughout the Backwalls.

The Bad Cola (or occasionally called Red Cola) is a rare cola that has an appearance of the normal Cola tinted red.

When you drink it, the player pauses, their skin tone gets paler, and soon instantly dies.
The Birthday Ice Cream is a large ice cream cone, obtainable by being the birthday person during the Birthday event.

The Burger is an edible item that is obtained from the Bloxdonalds event.

When the player consumes it, their screen becomes green, their camera jolts upwards going down, and it deals 25 health.

Coffee is a usable item obtained from the pool event that appears next to the edges of the pool.

It is used much like a soda; however, it gives no additional effects.

The Cola is an item that is obtainable at the second floor of The Bus.

When used, you'll restore a significant amount of health.

The Cold Cola is a variant of Colas that can be either found on the third floor of The Bus, or inside of Glacier Cave.

When used, the player will freeze for around 4 seconds and thaws after 6 seconds after freezing.

The Compass is a tool obtainable by purchasing it for 4 passenger rep during the Goat Station Event, or by stealing it.

When held, it'll always show an arrow pointing behind The Bus.

The Cramped Cola is a variant of the Cola series, that is located on the 2nd floor of the bus. It's inside of a cupboard next to the pizza box.

When used, you'll shrink and lose 30 health in the process, reversing itself when used again.

The Expired Taco is a gear obtained from the Time Travel event, and is obtained at the 'fizzy taco stand!!!!!!'.

When used, the player will have their camera jolted upwards and lose 75 health.

The Fake Rocket Launcher is an item obtained in the Shack event.

When used, it'll shoot out a blue brick and explode the player using it.

The Flying Skillbook is a non-permanent item stolen from GOATed Gas Station.

This item has no function whatsoever as its pages are glued shut. Perhaps buying it may magically fix it?

The Free-Modelled Cake (or known as Birthday Cake) is a consumable item in Bus Simulator, gotten from everyone in the Birthday Event.

When used it'll just produce a sound.
The Gameboy Advance is a item that can be found on the first floor of the bus, and it allows you to play 1v1 games with somebody else who also has the item out.

The Gas Station Gravity Coil is a tool obtainable by purchasing it for 15 passenger rep during the Goat Station Event event, or by stealing it.

When held, you'll recieve less gravity, albeit much worse compared to the original.

The Gas Station Ice Cream is a tool obtainable by purchasing it for 8 passenger rep during the Goat Station Event, or by stealing it.

When used, you'll restore 2 health.

The Goala Cola is an item you can obtain at the GOATed Gas Station.

The item is purely cosmetic, making you do a little dance while 'Goooaaaalllll!' plays after drinking it.

The GPS is a Gamepass item in Bus Simulator. It costs R$12.

When held, it displays a random location* along with the minutes until the next event.

The Helicopter is a permanent item bought from GOATed Gas Station for 100 Passenger Reputation if you have the Flying Skillbook in your inventory.

When equipped, it will slowly raise you off the ground speeding up until you reach a certain height, it also has a timer before you are forced to stop flying which then slowly charges over time while it's unused.
The Homemade Coffee is an temporary item from the Goat Station event, and recovers more health than the Cola and regular Coffee.

Hot Cola is an item that can be found on the second floor of The Bus underneath the Pizza Box.

When used, it'll set you ablaze, killing you after a while if not extinguished.

The Hyper Soda is a soda variant that can be obtained at the top of the platform next to the sign in the Obby event.

When used, it will provide a similar speed compared to Almond Water, but after a few seconds after consumption will massive spike in speed, then after a massive drop, making you slower than normal.

The Ice Cream is an edible item that is obtained from the ice cream truck.

When used, you'll regenerate a small amount of health.

Coffee is a usable item obtained from the pool event that appears next to the edges of the pool.

It is used much like a soda; however, it gives no additional effects.

Liquid Void is an item obtainable from random floor spawns in the Backwalls.

When used you will turn invisible for 20 seconds, then start flashing in an out until finally turning opaque again. However, if used less than 20 seconds after the effects are over, you will instead be killed.

The Magic Mirror is an item obtained by returning to the Glacier Cave after receiving the Animal Messenger badge from Frostbite's questline.

When used, you'll teleport to Frost's Den anytime, anywhere.
The Marker is an item that allows you to draw lines almost anywhere in the game, it currently has 3 tools, Export, Draw, and Erase.

The Megaphone is a gamepass item in Bus Simulator. It costs R$45, with its variants costing more.

When used, any message you send with it will be shouted, with a cooldown of 30 seconds per each.
The Megaphone EX is a gamepass item costing R$320. When used, your shout message is 22.22..% larger than normal messages, and your cooldown varies upon your message size.
Meygaphone~ is similar to the Megaphone. The only difference is that there's an emoji of 2 paws when doing a shout, and some words are 'furryified'. 'Oofs' are also replaced with meows.

The Mini-Bus is a miniature vehicle which resembles the bus used in the game. It can only fit 1 player, but drives faster than the bus.

The Mini-Bus costs R$125 to obtain.

Phone is one of the first tools in the game you obtain.

When used, it'll illuminate light out of its back.

The Pizza is an item obtainable from a pizza box in the second floor of the bus.

When used, it will heal you by a bit and equipping it will play a sound effect saying 'Pizza Time'.

RAM is a unique item at the GOATed Gas Station event, where you need to trigger a side quest to be able to pick up the item.

It has no function on its own, and is used merely to give to Tazer.
The RedBlox is an item in the GOATed Gas Station Event, and is a one-time use that makes you walk faster for a few seconds, like the Hyper Soda.
The RoEmulator is a gamepass item that lets you play games on your own, costing R$20. It has options of three games: Adventure Island, Race The Sunset, and Lunar Lander.

The Sandwich is a food item obtainable from the Picnic event.

When consumed, heals a tiny bit of health.

The sign is an item located at the third floor. It is placed next to the side of a chair. The sign simply says 'I HAVE A SIGN'.

When used, the player will jump very slightly a bunch of times.

The Spronkbib Popsicle is obtainable along with The Last One badge as a 1/800[1](formerly 1/1000) chance from the naturally spawning ice cream vans.

When used, it'll regenerate a significant amount, and persists in a couple of events.

The Toast is a temporary item from the Goat Station event, which can be obtained by clicking on the Toaster in Zeon's house.

When used, it'll regenerate a tiny amount of your health.
Tool is a temporary item that can be obtained after giving D6 a food or drink item, it does nothing.
